comments:
I have quite some XML files with system entity declarations. I get an internal error during "Processing Dirty Regions" and an additional error box when opening such an XML file and with every key stroke.

My project is a normal Java project containing just two files in a folder: the XML and the file with the external entities.

I had this behaviour for all versions of WST since 0.7 upto now.

Created an attachment (id=41991)
The file with the entities.

Created an attachment (id=41992)
The XML file.

Note, that I have setup up the Ant editor to exclude files with the name "project.xml" or "*.ent" in "Preferences.../Ant/Editor/Problems/Names" to prevent any interaction with the Ant plugin and I am opening the XML file explicitly with the XML Editor. Both files are in the same folder.

From the description of other error bugs concering "Processing Dirty Regions" I had the impression, that it was believed, the problem has something to do with java.facet or JSP, but I have this with every XML file containing external system entities - therefore the new bug report.

Stack trace:
=================================

	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.validation.XMLValidator._internalResolveEntity(XMLValidator.java:418)

	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:147)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1158)

	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.validation.core.AbstractNestedValidator.validateInJob(AbstractNestedValidator.java:89)

Which JRE have you been using, and is there a version of Xerces installed in its ext lib folder?

I am running Eclipse with Sun JDK 1.5.0_04 and the ext library contains only the files provided by the vanilla installation, so, no, there's no Xerces.

But your question raised some other deja vu .. and I found that there were two plugins installed providing "org.apache.xerces" (looking at the plugin info in the About box). Dunno which plugin setup provided the old one, but it was installed two years ago. After removing it manually, the error described above vanished completely (and I found two plugins with the id "org.apache.axis").

Thanks, J?rg
